channel.title: aba cx cup on the dubious monk
channel.description: Recent content in aba cx cup on the dubious monk

item.title: baby walter cross 2023 - day 2
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Queen Elizabeth Park Edmonton Course: stravalink I had hoped to do more racing this year, but it turned out that four was what I could handle with my work and other life commitments. So the second day of Baby Walter Cross was my season closer. The course this year went the opposite direction of 2022 which I think I preferred. The climbing of the stupid hill was still tough, but the descents weren’t terrifying and we got to skip the runup in favour of a singletrack descent (with roots that were highlighted but you needed to dodge).

item.title: baby walter cross 2023 - day 1
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Queen Elizabeth Park Edmonton Course: stravalink Baby Walter Cross is a two-day race put on by the Alberta Cyclocross Collective, which isn’t a club exactly, just all the cx lovers in Edmonton. The park has a really big hill, which makes for a lot of climbing. Apparently on the Saturday race (which I didn’t attend) there were some big crashes by people trying to bunny-hop the obstacles and failing badly.

item.title: hardcore hop n hurl 2023
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Voyageur Park Devon Course: stravalink I came into this race knowing that last year’s Puncheur Cross was my favourite. Unfortunately I had a training crash the Tuesday before this race, which put me in kind of a bad place. Mostly scraped up, but also a bit of a bruised wrist and some bruised ribs. I figured I’d be okay to race still, but I wasn’t setting my expectations too high.

item.title: drie zussen superprestige 2023
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Canmore Nordic Centre Canmore Course: stravalink ABA Cup race. Construction on the course. Looked beautiful in the mountains. This is where I’d like to go for a travelling race next year. results ABA Results CrossResults Podia Open Women Christiane BILODEAU Nico KNOLL Kelsey DUFFIELD Open Men Mark FAGNAN Finn BORSTMAYER Eric BERG Expert Men Jacob PLAYFAIR Larix HALLETT Brett GREINER Novice Men Petr HOLUB Mitchell ROBERTS Emmett MACKLEM Sport Men Patrick MCCRADY Nigel BAINES Sean SWEENEY Sport Women Lydia STACK-MICHASIW Daena SIDNEY Kathryn SWEENEY my results Did not race read more bike stuff

item.title: school of cross 2023
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Capilano Park Edmonton Course: stravalink Like the previous day’s Jim Horner Grand Prix ERTC’s School of Cross (p/b Blindman Brewing) 2023 race happened in Capilano Park. The air quality was a bit better on the day so only one race was cancelled (Open Women). results ABA Results CrossResults Podia Elite/Open Men Mark FAGNAN Graham FRANCIS Ryan MCLEAN Expert Men Paulo ALVES 1 Jacob PLAYFAIR Randy PERRY Novice Men Quinten MACKLEM2 Emmett MACKLEM Evan KINDZIERSKI Sport Men Ethan MCGHAN Ryan ARYCHUK Colin WEIR CHABA Sport Women Rachel DUMONT [^3] Kristin BAKER Madeline MAGLEO my results Did not race read more Earned promotion up to Open Men, with his second win (in a row, following JHGP) in Expert.

item.title: jim horner grand prix 2023
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Capilano Park Edmonton Course: stravalink I was so happy this race wasn’t taking place in Argyll Park this year. I hated the downhill that someone broke a collarbone on last year and lost so much time on it. Capilano Park was near my house and I could practice on it. But I didn’t practice hard enough on wet enough grass, because hoo boy did I not do well on that terrain.

item.title: the real diehl cyclocross 2023
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Canadian Southern Baptist Seminary - Cochrane Course: stravalink “The Real Diehl” Cyclocross Peloton’s first CX race they’ve put on. Swag included a UCI tire checker. results ABA Results CrossResults Podia Expert Men Scott DESMARAIS Spencer POOTZ Larix HALLETT1 Novice Men Joel DYCK William LEMIEUX Douglas GRAY Open Men Andrew DAVIDSON Shawn BUNNIN Mark KNOLL Open Women Pepper HARLTON Kelsey DUFFIELD Nico KNOLL Sport Men Nigel BAINES Robert MARTENS Garth STOTTS Sport Women Alina CUSTODIO Hazel ROBERTS Elan√© FERGUSON my results Did not race.

item.description: Tech Guide Location: Canadian Southern Baptist Seminary - Cochrane Course: stravalink1 It looks like this was a hot and windy race. results ABA Results CrossResults Podia Expert Men Scott DESMARAIS Emile VOGEL-NAKAMURA Spencer POOTZ Novice Men Joel DYCK Karol SIARKA Quinten MACKLEM Open Men Andrew DAVIDSON Shawn BUNNIN Mark KNOLL Open Women Sidney MCGILL Ella MYERS Nico KNOLL Sport Men Larix HALLETT Patrick MCCRADY Nigel BAINES Sport Women Avree COLLING Hazel ROBERTS Hilary BUCKLEY my results Did not race.

item.title: velocity cross 2023 - smoked out
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Strathcona Science Park Course: stravalink (shared with Tubs on Tubs) Sidney McGill was going to be racing in the Open Men category and I was really excited to see her, and to race in the Novice Men, but by 7am the AQHI was over 10 and no one wanted to get blacklung for a race (also the Alberta Bicycle Association won’t let you do anything if the index is over 7).

item.title: tubs on tubs supercalifragilisticexpialidocius prestige 2023
item.description: Tech Guide Location: Strathcona Science Park Course: stravalink Tubs on Tubs Supercalifragilisticexpialidocius Prestige was the race that was going to open up the 2023 ABA CX season. And it did for the Novice Men, Sport Men and Sport Women categories, but sadly, the AQHI hit 11 and the afternoon races had to be cancelled (along with the next day’s entire Velocity CX Race). But I got my race in, and it was really fun!

item.title: tubs on tubs superduper prestige 2022
item.description: I returned to cyclocross in 2022, and went back to the same race in the same park. I’m not sure if that makes this a classic or not. I’d tested this course beforehand. My house is just across the river from the “indestructible Strathcona Science Park”1 so this was where I’d been riding up and down hills and practicing my off-cambers the week before (see my idyllic practice image). In the tech guide the organizers had released it looked like the really super-steep downhill I’d wiped out on in my practice laps back in 2019 was not part of the course, which I appreciated.
